oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Robert R. Church, Jr., W.C. Handy, and Lt. George Lee
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hooks Brothers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
National Leaders
African Americans; African American men; African American businesspeople; African American musicians;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three African American gentlemen, all wearing suits and hats, standing in front of a plate glass window, 392 Beale Avenue.

Businessman and civic leader Robert R. Church, Jr. stands in front of his offices at 392 Beale Street, with musician W.C. Handy, and Lieutenant George Washington Lee, a World War I veteran who was also active in local politics. Handy's publishing company, Handy & Pace, was in business at this address until moving to New York City in 1918.
